amendatorysection.catchline: Plea of not guilty; record; day of trial; designation; continuance; when.
amendatorysection.para: If the accused pleads not guilty, the plea shall be entered on the indictment, and the prosecuting attorney shall, under the direction of the court, designate a day for trial, which shall be a day of the term at which the plea is made, unless the court, for good reasons, continues the case to a subsequent term.

annotation.para: Date for trial was properly designated. Kitts v. State, 153 Neb. 784, 46 N.W.2d 158 (1951).
Failure to endorse plea on indictment is not ground for reversal. Preuit v. People, 5 Neb. 377 (1877).
